body_content.explanation: the small solid pieces that sink to the bottom of some liquids, such as wine or coffee, that are not usually drunk:
examples: I wanted a last drink of coffee, but there were only dregs left.
He emptied the dregs of his tea into the sink.
She had drunk her coffee down to the dregs (= finished it).

body_content.explanation: parts of something that are left after most of it has gone:
examples: She was still suffering from the dregs of a flu virus.
By this time the company was down to the dregs of its cash reserves.
They get all the best food and we get the dregs.
